protocol_name: Rearing of Drosophila on Holidic Media (HM) for feeding behavior assays
protocol_name_html: Rearing of Drosophila on Holidic Media (HM) for feeding behavior assays
description: This protocol is part of the manuscript: Gonçalves et al. Commensal bacteria and essential amino acids control food choice behavior and reproduction. Plos Biology. 2017 Apr 18.
before_start: Prepare the required fly and bacterial media.
protocol_affiliation: Champalimaud Centre for the Unknown, School of Biological Sciences
manuscript_citation: Leitão-Gonçalves R, Carvalho-Santos Z, Francisco AP, Fioreze GT, Anjos M, Baltazar C, Elias AP, Itskov PM, Piper MDW, Ribeiro C, Commensal bacteria and essential amino acids control food choice behavior and reproduction. PLoS Biology 15(4). doi: 10.1371/journal.pbio.2000862
keywords: Drosophila, holidic medium, axenic, gnotobiotic, feeding behavior, feeding decisions, microbiota, diet, nutrients

guidelines:
Prepare yeast-based medium (YBM) as follows:

  • mix 8 g agar, 80 g barley malt syrup, 22 g sugar beet syrup, 80 g corn flour, 10 g soya flour, 18 g instant yeast, 8 ml propionic acid, and 12 ml nipagin (15% in 96% ethanol) and fill up to 1000 ml using milliQ filtered water
  • autoclave before pouring into polypropylene fly culture vials (VWR, #734-2261)
  • after solidifying, the food is supplemented with instant yeast granules on the surface

 

Perform all fly rearing, maintenance, and behavioral testing at 25°C in climate-controlled chambers at 70% relative humidity in a 12-hr-light-dark cycle (Aralab, FitoClima 60000EH).

components.data: Prepare yeast-based medium (YBM) according to the Guidelines.

source_data.annotation: YBM can be stored at 18ºC up to 3 days before use.
source_data.thread_text: YBM can be stored at 18ºC up to 3 days before use.
source_data.body: YBM can be stored at 18ºC up to 3 days before use.

components.data: Set up fly cultures using 5 females and 4 males per YBM vial to ensure a homogenous density of offspring among experiments.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Set up fly cultures using 5 females and 4 males per YBM vial to ensure a homogenous density of offspring among experiments.

components.data:
Keep the crosses in a dedicated incubator at 25º C, 70% relative humidity, and a 12-hr-light-dark cycle. Remove parental flies after 3 to 7 days and wait 14 days (since the day the crosses were set up) to obtain adult flies.

 

If you are using temperature sensitive alleles adjust rearing temperature accordingly and plan your experiments to account for the delay in the development.
components.name: Description

source_data.description:
Keep the crosses in a dedicated incubator at 25º C, 70% relative humidity, and a 12-hr-light-dark cycle. Remove parental flies after 3 to 7 days and wait 14 days (since the day the crosses were set up) to obtain adult flies.

 

If you are using temperature sensitive alleles adjust rearing temperature accordingly and plan your experiments to account for the delay in the development.

components.data: Sort the progeny according to the desired genotype, and collect 16 females into fresh YBM. Add 5 wild-type males to ensure that the females are mated. When testing males collect 20 males into fresh YBM.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Sort the progeny according to the desired genotype, and collect 16 females into fresh YBM. Add 5 wild-type males to ensure that the females are mated. When testing males collect 20 males into fresh YBM.

components.data: To ensure a well-fed state and minimize the microbial load, transfer the flies to fresh YBM after 48 hours.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: To ensure a well-fed state and minimize the microbial load, transfer the flies to fresh YBM after 48 hours.

components.data: Preparing adult flies to be tested for feeding behavior
components.name: Section

source_data.section: Preparing adult flies to be tested for feeding behavior

components.data: After 24 hours on fresh YBM tansfer the flies to the different HM. For this, prepare all the different HM needed according to the Holidic media (HM) preparation protocol. If required, innoculate HM with the commensal bacteria following the Inoculation of Holidic Media (HM) with bacteria protocol.
components.name: Description

If required, innoculate HM with the commensal bacteria following the Inoculation of Holidic Media (HM) with bacteria protocol.

components.data: Keep the flies on HM (with or withouth commensal bacteria) for 72 hours, and immediately test for feeding behavior.
